element.name: Eye
element.function: Light and Color Perception Sensor

element.name: Eye - rods and cones
element.function: after on-center/off-center edge extraction and zipping 100:1

element.name: Eye - somatic receptors
element.function: eye -> semilunar ganglion/ophthalmic -> PTR

element.name: Eye - visceral receptors
element.function: eye -> semilunar ganglion/ophthalmic -> STR, proprioception

element.name: Eye - inferior oblique muscle
element.function: extorsion, elevation, abduction

element.name: Eye - inferior rectus muscle
element.function: depression and adduction

element.name: Eye - medial rectus muscle
element.function: adducts the eyeball

element.name: Eye - superior rectus muscle
element.function: elevates, adducts, and rotates medially the eye

element.name: Eye - levator palpebrae superioris muscle
element.function: retracts/elevates eyelid

element.name: Eye - superior oblique muscle
element.function: superior oblique, rotation in a vertical plane - looking down and up, rotation in the plane of the face

element.name: Eye - lateral rectus muscle
element.function: lateral rectus, quick turn to the right -> compensatory reflex turning of two eyes to the left
element.notes: vestibular nucleus -> PPRF -> ABD -> this, larger motor neurons, c.n. VI

element.name: Eye pupil and accomodation motor muscles
Eye - ciliary muscle - sympathetic
element.function: to ciliary muscle to increase eye accomodation

element.name: Eye - ciliary muscle - parasympathetic
element.function: to ciliary muscle to inhibit eye accomodation

element.name: Eye - iris sphincter muscle
element.notes: sphincter pupillae is situated along the edge of the iris contracts to close the opening in the pupil
element.function: to sphincter pupillae to close pupil

element.name: Eye - iris dilator muscle
element.notes: dilator pupillae runs radially, like the spokes of a wheel, through the iris, and when it contracts this opens the pupil
element.function: to dilator pupillae to open pupil

element.name: Eye - orbicularis oculi muscle:temporal
element.notes: squints the eyes, and the part that is labeled, or outer part, is the basis for AU 6 in FACS, from intermediate facial subnucleus
element.comments: the inner part, mostly on the eyelids is the basis for AU 7 in FACS
element.function: orbital portion, contraction of the orbital to reduce glare

element.name: Eye - orbicularis oculi muscle:zygomatic
element.notes: squints the eyes, and the part that is labeled, or outer part, is the basis for AU 6 in FACS, from intermediate facial subnucleus
element.comments: the inner part, mostly on the eyelids is the basis for AU 7 in FACS
element.function: lacrimal part (tensor tarsi), conscious muscle to close eye; draws the eyelids and the ends of the lacrimal canals medialward and compresses them against the surface of the globe of the eye; compresses the lacrimal sac

element.name: Eye - orbicularis oculi muscle:palpebrale
element.notes: sleep, blink, corneal/blinking reflex
element.comments: small muscle at the corner of the eye
element.function: palpebral portion, acts involuntarily, closing the lids gently; involuntary muscle to close eye

element.name: Eye - superior tarsal muscle
element.function: raise the upper eyelid

element.name: Eye - inferior tarsal muscle
element.function: lower lid retraction

element.name: Eye - orbitalis muscle
element.function: protrusion of eyeball

element.name: Eye - lacrimal gland
element.notes: from superior salivatory to sphenopalatine ganglion

element.name: Eye - lacrimal gland and conjunctiva receptors
element.notes: sensory innervation to the gland and the conjunctiva, skin of the upper eyelid

element.name: Ear
element.function: Auditory and Vestibular Sensor

element.name: Ear - inner hair cells
element.notes: transform cochlea fluid vibrations into electrical signals
element.function: frequency-aligned tonotopic mapping

element.name: Ear - outer hair cells feedback
element.function: verifies amplify actions done

element.name: Ear - somatic receptors
element.comments: from auditory meatus to genuculate ganglion
element.function: from skin to geniculate ganglion to spinal trigeminal nucleus

element.name: Ear - outer ear skin
element.function: skin over the mastoid process, back of the auricle, lobule and a portion of the scalp

element.name: Ear - acoustic meatus skin
element.function: from skin lining external acoustic meatus, and tympanic membrane to trigeminal gangion

element.name: Ear - visceral receptors
element.notes: CN IX, from STR to VPM, timpanic cavity
element.function: pain, temperature, and touch

element.name: Ear - timpanic cavity
element.notes: STR to VPM
element.function: pain, temperature, and touch

element.name: Ear - cristae and maculae
element.notes: located in ampullae of semicircular canals, saccule and utricle
element.function: activate afferent receptors in response to rotational and linear acceleration

element.name: Ear - outer hair cells
element.notes: without functioning outer hair cells, the sensitivity decreases by approximately 50 dB, allows frequency discrimination, extend hearing range to about 200 kHz in some marine mammals
element.function: contracts basilar membrane; mechanically amplify low-level sound that enters cochlea

element.name: Ear - stapedius muscle
element.notes: control amplitude of sound waves from general external environment to inner ear
element.function: dampens vibrations of stapes

element.name: Ear - tympanic membrane muscle
element.notes: pull malleus medially, tensing tympanic membrane, damping vibration in ear ossicles
element.function: dampen sounds, such as those produced from chewing

element.name: Ear - anterior auricular muscle
element.function: pulls ear forward

element.name: Ear - posterior auricular muscle
element.function: pulls ear backward

element.name: Ear - superior auricular muscle
element.function: pulls ear upward

element.name: Ear - oblique muscle of auricle
element.function: movement of the ears

element.name: Ear - temporoparietalis muscle
element.function: assist the frontal belly in drawing the epicranial aponeurosis towards the front of the cranium

element.name: Nose
element.function: Olfaction Sensor

element.name: Nose - olfactory mucosa
element.function: Sensing smells

element.name: Nose - visceral nodose receptors
element.notes: to nodose ganglion to SOL
element.function: visceral sensations

element.name: Nose - visceral pharynx receptors
element.notes: to petrosal ganglion to SOL
element.function: visceral sensations

element.name: Nose - nasal glands
element.notes: from pterygopalatine ganglion (parasympathetic)
element.function: smelling control and moisturing

element.name: Nose move muscles
element.function: constricts nostrils, lower alar pars and helps to wrinkle nose

element.name: Nose - depressor septi nasi muscle
element.function: depression of nasal septum

element.name: Nose - levator labii superioris alaeque nasi muscle
element.function: dilates the nostril; elevates the upper lip and wing of the nose

element.name: Nose - nasalis muscle
element.function: compresses bridge, depresses tip of nose, elevates corners of nostrils

element.name: Nose - salpingopharyngeus muscle
element.function: raise the nasopharynx

element.name: Heart
element.function: Blood Supply

element.name: Heart - NE receptors of atrium muscles
element.notes: lowers the threshold potential of SA node cells, vasoconstriction of arteries and veins
element.function: increase overall activity of heart

element.name: Heart - upper cardiac muscle
element.function: increase spontaneous diastonic muscle cells depolarization; increase matabolic demands of heart

element.name: Heart - lower cardiac muscle, middle
element.function: increase heart rate (chronotropic effect) and force of cardiac contraction (inotropic effect)

element.name: Heart - lower cardiac muscle, stellar
element.function: increase heart rate (chronotropic effect) and force of cardiac contraction (inotropic effect)

element.name: Heart - ACh receptors of atrium muscles
element.notes: creating state of hyperpolarity in which cells are less easily excited
element.function: decrease firing rate of SA node, slowing transmission of pacemaker impulse

element.name: Heart - baroreceptors in aorta
element.notes: walls of arteries are distended by increase in blood pressure
element.function: increase in blood pressure signal

element.name: Heart - baroreceptors in carotid artery
element.notes: walls of arteries are distended by increase in blood pressure
element.function: increase in blood pressure signal

element.name: Heart - visceral receptors
element.function: temperature and pain

element.name: Immunity glands and meninges
element.function: Biological defences to avoid infection, disease, or other unwanted biological invasion

element.name: Protector - cranial meninges
element.function: primary function of the meninges and of the cerebrospinal fluid is to protect the central nervous system

element.name: Protector - tentorium cerebelli dura mater visceral receptors
element.function: visceral sensation of tentorium cerebelli and supratentorial falx cerebri

element.name: Protector - palatine tonsil
element.function: providing antibodies against illnesses and diseases such as diphtheria

element.name: Protector - lingual tonsil
element.function: production of antibodies that are part of natural immune system

element.name: Protector - pharyngeal tonsils
element.function: defense mechanism against air infections, produce white blood cells which are essential for immunity

element.name: Protector - hard palate mucous gland
element.function: produce mucous fluid; lubrication, immunological defence

element.name: Protector - soft palate mucous gland
element.function: produce mucous fluid; lubrication, immunological defence

element.name: Feeder - parotid gland
element.notes: one of salivary glands, from otic ganglion, hidration for chewing and swallowing
element.function: produces 25% of saliva in oral cavity, mostly serous

element.name: Feeder - submandibular gland
element.notes: one of salivary glands, from submandibular (submaxillary) ganglion
element.function: produces 70% of saliva in oral cavity, mixed serous (moisturing) and mucous (process food)

element.name: Feeder - sublingual gland
element.notes: one of salivary glands, from submandibular (submaxillary) ganglion
element.function: produces 5% of saliva in oral cavity, mostly mucous

element.name: Feeder - tongue gustatory hair cell
element.function: taste sensation

element.name: Feeder - epiglottis
element.function: taste sensation

element.name: Feeder - soft palate sparse taste receptors
element.function: taste sensation

element.name: Feeder - genioglossus muscle
element.function: keeps airway open and enables tongue to stick out and retract

element.name: Feeder - hyoglossus muscle
element.function: depress and retract the tongue, important in singing

element.name: Feeder - styloglossus muscle
element.function: chewing, talking, suckling, and many other functions of tongue

element.name: Feeder - chondroglossus muscle
element.function: depresses tongue

element.name: Feeder - palatoglossus muscle
element.function: raising the back part of the tongue

element.name: Feeder - transverse muscle of tongue
element.function: narrows and elongates tongue

element.name: Feeder - vertical muscle of tongue
element.function: flattens tongue

element.name: Feeder - inferior longitudinal muscle of tongue
element.function: shortens, retracts, pulls tip downward

element.name: Feeder - stylohyoid muscle
element.function: draw hyoid bone backwards and elevate tongue; elevate the hyoid during swallowing

element.name: Feeder - superior longitudinal muscle of tongue
element.function: shortens, turns tip upward, turns lateral margins upward

element.name: Feeder swallowing muscles and helper components
Feeder - digastric muscle, facial
element.function: opens the jaw when the masseter and the temporalis are relaxed

element.name: Feeder - digastric muscle, trigeminal
element.function: opens the jaw when the masseter and the temporalis are relaxed

element.name: Feeder - geniohyoid muscle
element.function: carry hyoid bone and the tongue upward during deglutition

element.name: Feeder - mylohyoid muscle
element.function: raises oral cavity floor, elevates hyoid, depresses mandible

element.name: Feeder - uvula receptors
element.function: preventing food from entering the nasal cavity

element.name: Feeder - musculus uvulae muscle
element.function: elevates and retracts the uvula, thickening the central part of the soft palate; shortens and broadens the uvula

element.name: Feeder - levator veli palatini muscle
element.function: elevates soft palate

element.name: Feeder - tensor veli palatini muscle
element.function: tension of the soft palate

element.name: Feeder - buccinator muscle
element.function: compress the cheeks against the teeth (blowing), mastication

element.name: Feeder - masseter muscle
element.function: elevation (as in closing of the mouth) and retraction of mandible

element.name: Feeder - lateral pterygoid muscle
element.function: depresses mandible

element.name: Feeder - medial pterygoid muscle
element.function: elevates mandible, closes jaw, helps lateral pterygoids in moving the jaw from side to side

element.name: Feeder - temporal muscle
element.function: elevation and retraction of mandible

element.name: Feeder - proprioception receptors of masticatory muscles
element.function: unconscious proprioception from muscle spindles; monosynaptic masticatory reflex

element.name: Speaker - palatine tonsil receptors
element.function: visceral mucous membrane over soft palate and tonsil

element.name: Speaker phonatory muscles
element.function: move vocal cords together and serve production of voice

element.name: Speaker - lateral cricoarytenoid muscle
element.function: adduct and medially rotate the cartilage, pulling the vocal ligaments towards the midline and backwards and so closing off the rima glottidis

element.name: Speaker - arytenoid muscle
element.function: approximate the arytenoid cartilages (close rima glottidis)

element.name: Speaker - cricothyroid muscle
element.function: tension and elongation of the vocal folds (has minor adductory effect)

element.name: Speaker - thyroarytenoid muscle
element.function: thickens the vocal folds and decreases length; also helps to adduct the vocal folds during speech

element.name: Speaker - oblique arytenoid muscle
element.function: sphincter of the laryngeal inlet

element.name: Speaker - posterior cricoarytenoid muscle
element.function: abducts and laterally rotates the cartilage, pulling the vocal ligaments away from the midline and forward and so opening the rima glottidis

element.name: Speaker - thyroepiglottic muscle
element.function: closes the inlet to the larynx

element.name: Speaker - aryepiglottic muscle
element.function: close the inlet

element.name: Speaker respiratory larynx muscles
element.function: move vocal cords apart and serve breathing

element.name: Speaker - thyrohyoid muscle
element.function: depresses the hyoid and elevates the larynx

element.name: Speaker - omohyoid muscle
element.function: depresses the larynx and hyoid bone; carries hyoid bone backward and to the side

element.name: Speaker - palatopharyngeus muscle
element.function: pulls pharynx and larynx

element.name: Speaker - sternohyoid muscle
element.function: depress hyoid bone

element.name: Speaker - sternothyroid muscle
element.function: elevates larynx, may slightly depress hyoid bone

element.name: Speaker - levator muscle of thyroid gland
element.function: elevates the thyroid gland

element.name: Face - face skin
element.function: sensory fibers from the skin

element.name: Face - parotid skin
element.function: facial skin over the parotid gland

element.name: Face - corrugator supercilii muscle
element.function: wrinkles forehead

element.name: Face - depressor supercilii muscle
element.function: depression of eyebrow

element.name: Face - frontalis muscle
element.function: raises the eyebrows

element.name: Face - occipitalis muscle
element.function: moves the scalp back

element.name: Face - levator labii superioris muscle
element.function: dilates the nostril; elevates the upper lip and wing of the nose

element.name: Face - procerus muscle
element.function: dilates the nostril; elevates the upper lip and wing of the nose

element.name: Face - zygomaticus minor muscle
element.function: elevates upper lip

element.name: Face - platysma muscle
element.function: draws the corners of the mouth inferiorly and widens it (as in expressions of sadness and fright). Also draws the skin of the neck superiorly when teeth are clenched

element.name: Face - depressor labii inferioris muscle
element.function: depress the lower lip

element.name: Face - risorius muscle
element.function: assist with pulling the lower lip downward and help to tighten the skin over the chin

element.name: Face - mentalis muscle
element.function: elevates and wrinkles skin of chin, protrudes lower lip

element.name: Face - transverse muscle of the chin
element.function: assist with pulling the lower lip downward and help to tighten the skin over the chin

element.name: Face surround and mouth corners muscles
Face - orbicularis oris muscle
element.function: pucker the lips

element.name: Face - zygomaticus major muscle, buccal
element.function: draws angle of mouth upward and laterally

element.name: Face - zygomaticus major muscle, proper
element.function: draws angle of mouth upward and laterally

element.name: Face - levator anguli oris muscle
element.function: smile (elevates angle of mouth)

element.name: Face - depressor anguli oris muscle
element.function: depresses angle of mouth

element.name: Neck
element.function: Move Head

element.name: Neck - cutaneous receptors of low neck
element.function: skin of medial infraclavicular region

element.name: Neck - scalenus anterior muscle
element.function: elevates first rib, rotate the neck to the opposite side

element.name: Neck - scalenus medius muscle
element.function: elevate 1st rib, laterally flex (bend) the neck to the same side

element.name: Neck - scalenus posterior muscle
element.function: elevate 2nd rib, tilt the neck to the same side

element.name: Neck - longus capitis muscle
element.function: flexion of neck at atlanto-occipital joint

element.name: Neck - longus colli muscle
element.function: flexes the neck and head

element.name: Neck - rectus capitis anterior muscle
element.function: flexion of neck at atlanto-occipital joint

element.name: Neck - rectus capitis lateralis muscle
element.function: sidebend at atlanto-occipital joint, takes care of flexing the neck

element.name: Neck - sternocleidomastoid muscle
element.function: acting alone, tilts head to its own side and rotates it so the face is turned towards the opposite side; acting together, flexes the neck, raises the sternum and assists in forced inspiration

element.name: Neck - obliquus capitis inferior muscle
element.function: rotation of head and neck

element.name: Neck - obliquus capitis superior muscle
element.function: extends head and flex head to the ipsilateral side

element.name: Neck - rectus capitis posterior major muscle
element.function: ipsilateral rotation of head and extension

element.name: Neck - rectus capitis posterior minor muscle
element.function: extends the head at the neck, but is considered to be more of a sensory organ than a muscle

element.name: Neck - semispinalis capitis
element.function: extend the head

element.name: Neck - splenius capitis muscle
element.function: prime mover for head extension; can also allow lateral flexion and rotation of the cervical spine

element.name: Neck - splenius cervicis muscle
element.function: bilaterally: extend the head and neck, unilaterally: lateral flexion to the same side, rotation to the same side

element.name: Liver
element.function: Blood Sanity

element.name: Liver - glucose and osmoreceptors
element.function: sensation of lipids, glucose, and metabolites (after eating and drinking) and triggers the nervous system to make appropriate physiological changes

element.name: Liver - visceral receptors
element.function: pain from the liver parenchyma

element.name: Liver - abdominal alimentary tract glands
element.function: Increase plasma protein synthesis and secretion

element.name: Stomach - stomach nutrition sensor
element.function: sense independently to tongue and oral taste receptors glucose, carbohydrates proteins, and fats

element.name: Stomach - outer longitudinal and inner circular smooth muscles
element.function: acetylcholine activates muscarinic receptors on smooth muscles - increasing motility of the stomach

element.name: Stomach - mucosal gastric glands
element.function: acetylcholine activates muscarinic receptors cause an increase in gastric juice secretion

element.name: Stomach - enzyme glands
element.function: secretes protein-digesting enzymes called proteases and strong acids to aid in food digestion; digestion; nutrition sensor; some absorption

element.name: Stomach - small intestine
element.function: where most chemical digestion takes place; food from stomach is allowed into duodenum through pylorus by pyloric sphincter; absorb nutrients from ingested food

element.name: Stomach - duodentum
element.function: food intake regulation, via glucoreception in taste receptors

element.name: Stomach - colon
element.function: extracts water and salt from solid wastes; storing waste

element.name: Stomach - spleen
element.function: red pulp - blood filter, removes old red blood cells, holds a reserve of blood, recycles iron; white pulp - synthesizes antibodies in its white pulp and removes antibody-coated bacteria and antibody-coated blood cells by way of blood and lymph node circulation

element.name: Stomach - kidney
element.function: regulating acid-base balance, electrolyte concentrations, extracellular fluid volume, blood pressure, filter to urine

element.name: Lung
element.function: Oxigen Supply

element.name: Lung - pulmonary neuroepithelial bodies
element.function: trachea, bronchial tree and lungs - intraepithelial receptors

element.name: Lung - pericardium and pleura receptors
element.function: somatic sensations

element.name: Lung - pulmonary stretch receptors
element.function: imitate the Hering-Breuer reflex, which reduces the respiratory rate; increased firing from the stretch receptors also increases production of pulmonary surfactant

element.name: Lung - glands of trachea, lungs, and bronchi
element.function: increase in airway secretions

element.name: Lung - smooth muscles of trachea and bronchial tree
element.function: constriction of trachea and bronchioles

element.name: Lung - thoracic diaphragm
element.function: increases thoracic cavity volume; inhalation

element.name: Lung - stylopharyngeus muscle
element.function: elevate the larynx, elevate the pharynx, swallowing

element.name: Hand
element.function: Primary Execution Motor

element.name: Hand - hand somatic receptors
element.function: somatic sensations

element.name: Hand - infraspinatus muscle
element.function: lateral rotation of arm; adduction of arm and stabilizes humerus

element.name: Hand - supraspinatus muscle
element.function: abduction of arm and stabilizes humerus

element.name: Hand - deltoid muscle, anterior
element.function: shoulder flexion

element.name: Hand - coracobrachialis muscle
element.function: flexes and adducts humerus

element.name: Hand - levator claviculae muscle
element.function: lifts clavicle

element.name: Hand - levator scapulae muscle, roots
element.function: elevates scapula and tilts its glenoid cavity inferiorly by rotating scapula

element.name: Hand - levator scapulae muscle, scapular
element.function: elevates scapula and tilts its glenoid cavity inferiorly by rotating scapula

element.name: Hand - pectoralis major muscle
element.function: clavicular head: flexes the humerus; sternocostal head: extends the humerus; as a whole, adducts and medially rotates the humerus. It also draws the scapula anteriorly and inferiorly

element.name: Hand - rhomboid major muscle
element.function: retracts the scapula and rotates it to depress the glenoid cavity; it also fixes the scapula to the thoracic wall

element.name: Hand - rhomboid minor muscle
element.function: retracts the scapula and rotates it to depress the glenoid cavity; it also fixes the scapula to the thoracic wall

element.name: Hand - serratus anterior muscle
element.function: retracts the scapula and rotates it to depress the glenoid cavity; it also fixes the scapula to the thoracic wall

element.name: Hand - sternalis muscle
element.function: protract and stabilize scapula, assists in upward rotation

element.name: Hand - subscapularis muscle, lower
element.function: rotates medially humerus; stabilizes shoulder

element.name: Hand - subscapularis muscle, upper
element.function: rotates medially humerus; stabilizes shoulder

element.name: Hand - teres major muscle
element.function: internal rotation of the humerus

element.name: Hand - latissimus dorsi muscle
element.function: pulls the forelimb dorsally and caudally

element.name: Hand - deltoid muscle, lateral and posterior
element.function: shoulder abduction, extension

element.name: Hand - pectoralis minor muscle
element.function: stabilizes the scapula by drawing it inferiorly and anteriorly against the thoracic wall

element.name: Hand - subclavius muscle
element.function: depression of clavicle

element.name: Hand - trapezius muscle
element.function: descending (superior) part elevates; ascending (inferior) part depresses; and middle part (or all parts together) retracts scapula; descending and ascending parts act together to rotate glenoid cavity superiorly

element.name: Hand - biceps muscle
element.function: flexes elbow and supinates forearm

element.name: Hand - brachialis muscle
element.function: flexion at elbow joint

element.name: Hand - pronator quadratus muscle
element.function: pronates the forearm

element.name: Hand - pronator teres muscle
element.function: pronation of forearm, flexes elbow

element.name: Hand - teres minor muscle
element.function: laterally rotates and adducts the arm

element.name: Hand - triceps brachii muscle, axillary
element.function: extends forearm, caput longum adducts shoulder

element.name: Hand - triceps brachii muscle, radial
element.function: extends forearm, caput longum adducts shoulder

element.name: Hand - articularis cubiti muscle
element.function: lifts capsule away from joint

element.name: Hand - supinator muscle
element.function: supinates forearm

element.name: Hand - anconeus muscle
element.function: partly blended in with the triceps, which it assists in extension of the forearm; stabilises the elbow and abducts the ulna during pronation

element.name: Hand - brachioradialis muscle
element.function: stabilizer of elbow joint

element.name: Hand - flexor carpi radialis muscle
element.function: flexion and abduction at wrist

element.name: Hand - flexor carpi ulnaris muscle
element.function: flexion and adduction of wrist

element.name: Hand - flexor digitorum profundus muscle, interosseous
element.function: flex hand, interphalangeal joints; flexor of the wrist (midcarpal), metacarpophalangeal and interphalangeal joints; flexes the 2-5 digits

element.name: Hand - palmaris longus muscle
element.function: wrist flexor

element.name: Hand - palmaris brevis muscle
element.function: wrinkle skin of palm

element.name: Hand - extensor digiti minimi muscle
element.function: extends and adducts the wrist

element.name: Hand - extensor carpi radialis brevis muscle
element.function: extensor at the wrist joint, abducts the hand at the wrist

element.name: Hand - extensor carpi radialis longus muscle
element.function: extensor and abductor of the hand at the wrist joint

element.name: Hand - flexor pollicis longus muscle
element.function: flexor of the phalanges of the thumb

element.name: Hand - flexor pollicis brevis muscle, median
element.function: flexion of thumb

element.name: Hand - flexor digitorum superficialis muscle
element.function: flexor of fingers (primarily at proximal interphalangeal joints); flexion of the middle phalanges of the fingers at the proximal interphalangeal joints

element.name: Hand - abductor digiti minimi muscle of hand
element.function: abduction of little finger

element.name: Hand - abductor pollicis brevis muscle
element.function: abduction of thumb

element.name: Hand - adductor pollicis muscle
element.function: adducts the thumb at the carpometacarpal joint

element.name: Hand - dorsal interossei muscles of the hand
element.function: abduct fingers

element.name: Hand - flexor digiti minimi brevis of hand
element.function: flexes little finger

element.name: Hand - flexor digitorum profundus muscle, ulnar
element.function: flex hand, interphalangeal joints; flexor of the wrist (midcarpal), metacarpophalangeal and interphalangeal joints; flexes the 2-5 digits

element.name: Hand - flexor pollicis brevis muscle, ulnar
element.function: flexion of thumb

element.name: Hand - lumbricals of the hand muscles, median
element.function: flex metacarpophalangeal joints, extend interphalangeal joints

element.name: Hand - lumbricals of the hand muscles, ulnar
element.function: flex metacarpophalangeal joints, extend interphalangeal joints

element.name: Hand - opponens digiti minimi muscle
element.function: draws 5th metacarpal anteriorly and rotates it, bringing little finger (5th digit) into opposition with thumb

element.name: Hand - opponens pollicis muscle
element.function: opposition of the thumb

element.name: Hand - palmar interossei muscles
element.function: adduct the fingers towards middle finger

element.name: Hand - abductor pollicis longus muscle
element.function: abduction, extension of thumb

element.name: Hand - extensor carpi ulnaris muscle
element.function: extends the little finger at all joints

element.name: Hand - extensor digitorum muscle
element.function: extension of hand and fingers

element.name: Hand - extensor indicis muscle
element.function: extends index finger, wrist

element.name: Hand - extensor pollicis brevis muscle
element.function: extension of thumb at metacarpophalangeal joint

element.name: Hand - extensor pollicis longus muscle
element.function: extension of the thumb (metacarpophalangeal and interphalangeal)

element.name: Leg
element.function: Primary Execution Motor

element.name: Leg - somatic receptors
element.function: somatic sensations

element.name: Leg - piriformis muscle
element.function: rotate laterally (outward) the thigh

element.name: Leg - adductor brevis muscle
element.function: adduction of hip

element.name: Leg - adductor longus muscle
element.function: adduction of thigh

element.name: Leg - adductor magnus muscle, obturator
element.function: adduction of hip

element.name: Leg - adductor magnus muscle, tibial
element.function: adduction of hip

element.name: Leg - adductor minimus muscle, obturator
element.function: adduction and lateral rotation of thigh

element.name: Leg - adductor minimus muscle, tibial
element.function: adduction and lateral rotation of thigh

element.name: Leg - biceps femoris muscle, tibial
element.function: extends hip joint (long head only)

element.name: Leg - gemellus inferior muscle
element.function: rotates laterally thigh

element.name: Leg - gemellus superior muscle
element.function: rotates laterally thigh

element.name: Leg - gluteus medius muscle
element.function: abduction of the hip; preventing adduction of the hip. Medial rotation of thigh

element.name: Leg - gluteus minimus muscle
element.function: works in concert with gluteus medius: abduction of the hip; preventing adduction of the hip; medial rotation of thigh

element.name: Leg - gracilis muscle
element.function: flexes hip, knee

element.name: Leg - iliacus muscle
element.function: flexes and rotates laterally thigh

element.name: Leg - obturator externus muscle
element.function: adduct thigh, rotate laterally thigh

element.name: Leg - obturator internus muscle
element.function: abducts rotates laterally thigh, and stabiliser of the hip during walking

element.name: Leg - pectineus muscle, femoral
element.function: thigh - flexion, adduction, medial rotation

element.name: Leg - pectineus muscle, obturator
element.function: thigh - flexion, adduction, medial rotation

element.name: Leg - psoas major muscle
element.function: flexes and rotates laterally thigh

element.name: Leg - psoas minor muscle
element.function: weak trunk flexor

element.name: Leg - quadratus femoris muscle
element.function: lateral rotation of thigh

element.name: Leg - sartorius muscle
element.function: flexion, lateral rotation and abduction of thigh; flexion and medial rotation of leg

element.name: Leg - tensor fasciae latae muscle
element.function: thigh - flexion, medial rotation; trunk stabilization

element.name: Leg - gluteus maximus muscle
element.function: external rotation and extension of the hip joint, supports the extended knee through the iliotibial tract, chief antigravity muscle in sitting

element.name: Leg - gastrocnemius muscle
element.function: plantar flexion, flexion of knee (minor)

element.name: Leg - popliteus muscle
element.function: medial rotation and flexion of knee

element.name: Leg - biceps femoris muscle, peroneal
element.function: flexes knee joint, laterally rotates knee joint (when knee is flexed)

element.name: Leg - semimembranosus muscle
element.function: hip extension, knee flexion

element.name: Leg - semitendinosus muscle
element.function: flex knee, extend hip joint

element.name: Leg - articularis genu muscle
element.function: pulling the suprapatellar bursa during extension of the knee

element.name: Leg - obliquus genu muscle
element.function: maintaining patella position and limiting injuries to the knee

element.name: Leg - rectus femoris muscle
element.function: knee extension; hip flexion

element.name: Leg - vastus intermedius muscle
element.function: extends knee

element.name: Leg - vastus lateralis muscle
element.function: extends and stabilizes knee

element.name: Leg - vastus medialis muscle
element.function: extends knee

element.name: Leg - tibialis posterior muscle
element.function: inversion of the foot, plantar flexion of the foot at the ankle; key muscle and tendon for stabilization, produce inversion and assists in the plantar flexion of the foot at the ankle

element.name: Leg - abductor hallucis muscle
element.function: abducts hallux

element.name: Leg - plantaris muscle
element.function: plantar flexes foot and flexes knee

element.name: Leg - quadratus plantae muscle
element.function: assists flexor digitorum longus in flexion of DIP joints

element.name: Leg - adductor hallucis muscle
element.function: adducts hallux

element.name: Leg - accessory soleus muscle
element.function: plantar flexion

element.name: Leg - fibularis brevis muscle
element.function: plantar flexion, eversion

element.name: Leg - fibularis longus muscle
element.function: plantar flexion, eversion

element.name: Leg - soleus muscle
element.function: plantar flexion

element.name: Leg - fibularis tertius muscle
element.function: dorsi flexes and everts foot

element.name: Leg - tibialis anterior muscle
element.function: dorsiflex and invert the foot

element.name: Leg - extensor hallucis brevis muscle
element.function: extension of hallux

element.name: Leg - flexor digitorum longus muscle
element.function: flex digits

element.name: Leg - flexor hallucis longus muscle
element.function: flexes all joints of the big toe, plantar flexion of the ankle joint

element.name: Leg - abductor digiti minimi muscle of foot
element.function: flex and abduct the fifth toe

element.name: Leg - flexor digitorum brevis muscle
element.function: flexes lateral four toes

element.name: Leg - lumbrical muscle of foot, lateral
element.function: flex proximal phalanges and extend middle and distal phalanges of lateral four digits

element.name: Leg - lumbrical muscle of foot, medial
element.function: flex proximal phalanges and extend middle and distal phalanges of lateral four digits

element.name: Leg - flexor digiti minimi brevis muscle of foot
element.function: flex and adduct the fifth toe

element.name: Leg - flexor hallucis brevis muscle
element.function: plantar nerve, medial, branches to LAFF muscles

element.name: Leg - dorsal interossei muscles of the foot
element.function: abduct toes

element.name: Leg - plantar interossei muscles
element.function: abduct toes

element.name: Leg - extensor digitorum brevis muscle
element.function: extends digits 2, 3, and 4

element.name: Leg - extensor digitorum longus muscle
element.function: extension of toes and ankle; Extensor hallucis brevis muscle - extension of hallux

element.name: Leg - extensor hallucis longus muscle
element.function: extends the big toe and assists in dorsiflexion of the foot at the ankle; also is a weak invertor

element.name: Trunk
element.function: Body Movements

element.name: Trunk - somatic receptors
element.function: somatic sensation from skin of lower abdomen and lateral side of gluteal region

element.name: Trunk - iliocostalis muscle
element.function: extends and lateral flexes spine

element.name: Trunk - rotatores muscles
element.function: facilitates the unilateral rotation and bilateral extension of the spine

element.name: Trunk - spinalis muscle
element.function: lateral flexion of spine

element.name: Trunk - semispinalis dorsi (thoracis)
element.function: extends vertebral column

element.name: Trunk - interspinales muscles
element.function: aid in extension and rotation of vertebral column

element.name: Trunk - intertransversarii muscle
element.function: aid in lateral flexion of vertebral column; acting bilaterally, stabilize vertebral column

element.name: Trunk - levatores costarum muscles
element.function: elevate ribs, assisting respiration; assist with lateral flexion of vertebral column}

element.name: Trunk - longissimus muscle
element.function: extends spine

element.name: Trunk - multifidus muscle
element.function: stabilizes vertebrae in local movements of vertebral column

element.name: Trunk - quadratus lumborum muscle
element.function: extension of lumbar vertebral column, with bilateral contraction; alone, lateral flexion of vertebral column; together, depression of thoracic rib cage

element.name: Trunk - semispinalis cervicis
element.function: extends and rotates the head to the contralateral side and also extends the ribs

element.name: Trunk - external intercostal muscles
element.function: aid in quiet and forced inhalation

element.name: Trunk - serratus posterior superior muscle
element.function: elevate the ribs which aids in inspiration

element.name: Trunk - subcostalis muscle
element.function: synergist in aiding the internal intercostal muscles with forced exhalation

element.name: Trunk - transversus thoracis muscle
element.function: depresses the ribs; aids in exertional expiration by decreasing the transverse diameter of the thoracic cage

element.name: Trunk - internal intercostal muscles
element.function: aid in forced expiration

element.name: Trunk - serratus posterior inferior muscle
element.function: depress the lower ribs, aiding in expiration

element.name: Trunk - rectus abdominis muscle
element.function: flexion of trunk/lumbar vertebrae; keeping the internal organs intact and in creating intra-abdominal pressure, such as when exercising or lifting heavy weights

element.name: Trunk - abdominal internal oblique muscle
element.function: compresses abdomen and rotates vertebral column

element.name: Trunk - pyramidalis muscle
element.function: tensing the linea alba

element.name: Trunk - abdominal external oblique muscle
element.function: rotates torso

element.name: Trunk - transversus abdominis muscle
element.function: compress the ribs and viscera, providing thoracic and pelvic stability

element.name: Breast
element.function: Milk Supply

element.name: Breast - skin receptors
element.function: breast somatic sensation

element.name: Breast - nipple smooth muscles
element.function: female - erection of nipples due to contraction of smooth muscle

element.name: Genitalia
element.function: Reproductive system

element.name: Genitalia - utetovaginal visceral receptors
element.function: sexual sensations

element.name: Genitalia - visceral sexual receptors
element.function: sexual sensations

element.name: Genitalia - bulbospongiosus muscle
element.function: in males, empties the urethra; in females, clenches the vagina

element.name: Genitalia - pubococcygeus muscle
element.function: controls urine flow and contracts during orgasm

element.name: Genitalia - ischiocavernosus muscle
element.function: stabilize the erect penis or (in females) tense the vagina during orgasm

element.name: Genitalia - corpus cavernosum penis
element.function: penile erection; simultaneously the ischiocavernosus and bulbospongiosus muscles compress the veins of the corpora cavernosa restricting the egress and circulation of this blood

element.name: Genitalia - uterus, sympathetic contractors
element.function: contraction of smooth muscles of myometrium, decreased blood flow, loss of erection

element.name: Genitalia - parasympathetic uterus vasodilators
element.function: female - contraction of smooth muscles of myometrium, increased blood flow; sexual response by directing blood flow to the pelvis and to the external genitalia, including the ovaries, vagina, labia, and clitoris

element.name: Genitalia - vagina, sympathetic vasoconstrictors
element.function: vasoconstriction of fibromuscular tube, loss of erection

element.name: Genitalia - parasympathetic vaginal vasodilators
element.function: female - contraction of smooth muscles of myometrium, increased blood flow

element.name: Genitalia - corpus cavernosum clitoridis
element.function: clitoral erection; simultaneously the ischiocavernosus and bulbospongiosus muscles compress the veins of the corpora cavernosa restricting the egress and circulation of this blood

element.name: Genitalia - ejaculation muscles and glands, pregnancy and lifecycle support
Genitalia - man ejaculation muscles and glands
Genitalia - cowper gland
element.function: produces a clear, salty, viscous secretion known as pre-ejaculate, homologous to Bartholin glands in females

element.name: Genitalia - prostate gland
element.function: secrete a slightly alkaline fluid, milky or white in appearance, constitutes 50-75 percents of the volume of the semen along with spermatozoa and seminal vesicle fluid

element.name: Genitalia - vas deferens
element.function: male - emission (prior to ejaculation), contracts, propelling sperm forward

element.name: Genitalia - deep transverse perineal muscle, penis
element.function: fixation of central tendon of perineum, support of pelvic floor, expulsion of semen in males and last drops of urine in both sexes

element.name: Genitalia - woman ejaculation muscles and glands
Genitalia - bartholin gland
element.function: secretes mucus to lubricate the vagina

element.name: Genitalia - skenes gland
element.function: cause female ejaculation and G-Spot orgasms

element.name: Genitalia - cervix
element.function: female - produces cervical mucus that changes in consistency during the menstrual cycle to prevent or promote pregnancy

element.name: Genitalia - deep transverse perineal muscle, clitoris
element.function: fixation of central tendon of perineum, support of pelvic floor and last drops of urine in both sexes

element.name: Genitalia - cremaster muscle
element.function: raise and lower the scrotum, acts quickly, it is a reflex

element.name: Genitalia - dartos muscle
element.function: corrugates the scrotum; contraction reduces the surface area available for heat loss, thus reducing heat loss and warming the testicles; expansion increases the surface area, promoting heat loss and thus cooling the testicles.

element.name: Ureter
element.function: Extract urine from blood in kidney and propel urine to urinary bladder and to outside

element.name: Ureter - ureter visceral receptors
element.function: respond to stretch and free nerve endings in the bladder mucosa that respond to pain and temperature

element.name: Ureter - detrusor urinae muscle, parasympathetic
element.function: parasympathetic contracts, to urinate

element.name: Ureter - internal sphincter muscle of urethra, parasympathetic
element.function: parasympathetic relaxes the muscle

element.name: Ureter - detrusor urinae muscle, sympathetic
element.function: sympathetic relaxes, to store urine

element.name: Ureter - internal sphincter muscle of urethra, sympathetic
element.function: sympathetic contracts the muscle

element.name: Ureter - external sphincter muscle of female urethra
element.function: control urination, constricts urethra, maintain urinary continence

element.name: Ureter - external sphincter muscle of male urethra
element.function: control urination, constricts urethra, maintain urinary continence

element.name: Rectum
element.function: Removal of undigested materials from the digestive tract through defecation

element.name: Rectum - large intestine visceral receptors
element.function: sensations of fullness and urgency, pain

element.name: Rectum - sphincter ani internus muscle, parasympathetic
element.function: keep the anal canal and anus closed, aids in the expulsion of the feces, inhibit contraction

element.name: Rectum - sphincter ani internus muscle, sympathetic
element.function: stimulate and maintain internal anal sphincter contraction

element.name: Rectum - superficial transverse perineal muscle
element.function: fixation of central tendon of perineum, support of pelvic floor

element.name: Rectum - corrugator cutis ani muscle
element.function: raises the skin into ridges around the margin of the anus

element.name: Rectum - sphincter ani externus muscle
element.function: keep the anal canal and anus closed, aids in the expulsion of the feces

element.name: Rectum - puborectalis muscle
element.function: inhibit defecation

element.name: Rectum - coccygeus muscle
element.function: pulls coccyx forward after defecation, closing in the back part of the outlet of the pelvis

element.name: Rectum - iliococcygeus muscle
element.function: supports the viscera in pelvic cavity

element.name: Blood vessels
element.function: Blood pressure control

element.name: Vessels - parotid gland vasoconstrictors
element.function: reduces glandular bloodflow

element.name: Vessels - submandibular gland vasoconstrictors
element.notes: volume decreases, but the secretions are increased by parasympathetic and sympathetic innervation
element.function: reduces glandular bloodflow, thereby decreasing the volume of fluid in salivary secretions

element.name: Vessels - sublingual gland vasoconstrictors
element.function: reduces glandular bloodflow

element.name: Vessels - heart blood vessels
element.function: constrict vessels resulting in poor circulation

element.name: Vessels - thorathic arterial vasoconstrictors
element.function: increase in systemic blood pressure

element.name: Vessels - breast blood vessels
element.function: vasomotor breast sympathetic fibers

element.name: Vessels - stomach blood vessels
element.function: vasomotor stomach sympathetic fibers

element.name: Vessels - liver blood vessels
element.function: vasomotor liver sympathetic fibers

element.name: Vessels - renal blood vessels
element.function: vasomotor renal sympathetic fibers

element.name: Vessels - wall of brachial artery smooth muscles
element.function: increase in systemic blood pressure

element.name: Vessels - arm blood vessels
element.function: constrict vessels resulting in poor circulation to limb

element.name: Vessels - forearm blood vessels
element.function: vasomotor forearm sympathetic fibers

element.name: Endocrine Glands
element.function: Secrete hormones directly into the circulatory system to be carried toward a distant target organ

element.name: Endocrine - pituitary gland
element.function: release hormones by request from HT
element.notes: secretes most of the hormones, also known as Hypophysis

element.name: Endocrine - pineal gland
element.function: control of sexual development

element.name: Endocrine - thyroid gland
element.function: release thyroid hormones into blood to rise oxygen use and heat production

element.name: Endocrine - parathyroid gland
element.function: release parathyroid hormones into blood to increase in blood calcium levels

element.name: Endocrine - pancreas
element.function: release digestive enzymes that act in small intestine to increase rate of glucose uptake and metabolism by most body cells

element.name: Endocrine - pancreas, sympathetic
element.function: sympathetic, a2: decreases secretion from beta cells, increases secretion from alpha cells, b2: increases secretion from beta cells

element.name: Endocrine - pancreas, parasympathetic
element.function: parasympathetic, stimulates insulin secretion, M3: increases stimulation of alpha cells and beta cells

element.name: Endocrine - adrenal gland
element.function: releasing hormones in response to stress

element.name: Endocrine - gonads
element.function: release estrogen, progesterone and testosterone hormones to promote maturation of reproductive organs

element.name: Endocrine - testicle gland
element.function: produce androgens, primarily testosterone (growth of muscle mass and strength, regulator of cognitive and physical energy, sperm development

element.name: Endocrine - ovary gland
element.function: secretes estrogen (maturation and maintenance of the reproductive organs), testosterone (prepares the uterus for pregnancy, and the mammary glands for lactation) and progesterone (promoting menstrual cycle changes in the endometrium
